summary: This document is an email chain from July 28, 2019, regarding the status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It reports that Epstein was being taken off psychological observation, noted he was psychologically stable, but complained of numbness in his right arm and neck, and mentioned a noisy toilet in his cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) who is the subject of the email chain regarding his psychological observation status and physical complaints.

events.title: Epstein's Psychological Observation Update
events.description: An email chain reports that inmate Jeffrey Epstein is being taken off psychological observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). He is described as psychologically stable but complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, and a noisy toilet in his cell.

keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was reported as being taken off psychological observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
Epstein was described as 'psychologically stable' but complained of numbness in his right arm and neck, and an inability to make a fist with his right hand.
Epstein reported that a noisy toilet in his cell had been running for 45 minutes the previous night, and he was to be moved to another cell if the issue persisted.
The document is an internal email chain among correctional staff regarding Epstein's status and condition shortly before his death.
